sentences.en: .A cold breeze was blowing hard .
sentences.cn: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.en: A cold breeze was blowing hard .
sentences.cn: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.en: A cold breeze was blowing hard.
sentences.cn: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.en: A lorry travelling south had a blow-out and crashed.
sentences.cn: 一辆南行的卡车爆胎并撞车了。

sentences.en: a package that blows the doors off anything on the market.
sentences.cn: 一种比市场上任何促销手段远为成功的套餐式销售方法。

sentences.en: A storm blew up.
sentences.cn: 风暴骤起

sentences.en: Asking those kind of questions could blow my cover.
sentences.cn: 问那种问题会暴露我的身份。

sentences.en: blow out a candle.
sentences.cn: 吹灭蜡烛

sentences.en: blow up a tire.
sentences.cn: 给轮胎充气

sentences.en: bombs blowing up.
sentences.cn: 爆炸的炸弹

sentences.en: He blew the smoke right in my face.
sentences.cn: 他直对着我的脸吐烟。

sentences.en: He delivered a knockout blow to all of his rivals.
sentences.cn: 他给所有对手以致命一击。

sentences.en: He raised his hand to fend off the blow.
sentences.cn: 他抬起手来抵挡那一拳。

sentences.en: He showed him how to blow into the ivory mouthpiece.
sentences.cn: 他给他演示如何吹奏象牙吹口乐器。

sentences.en: He went off to hospital after a blow to the face.
sentences.cn: 他脸部受到重击之后就去了医院。

sentences.en: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.cn: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.en: His mother’s death was a shattering blow .
sentences.cn: 他母亲的死是一个沉重的打击。

sentences.en: Hollywood cameramen have good reason to blow their own trumpets.
sentences.cn: 好莱坞的摄影师们有足够的理由可以自我吹嘘。

sentences.en: It is impossible to say who struck the fatal blow.
sentences.cn: 很难判断是谁给了致命的一击。

sentences.en: It is understood he had a blow-up with coach Chris Anderson.
sentences.cn: 据了解，他和教练克里斯·安德森之间爆发了激烈争吵。

sentences.en: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
sentences.cn: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.en: It was so humiliating, a terrible blow to my self-esteem.
sentences.cn: 这件事如此丢脸，深深地挫伤了我的自尊心。

sentences.en: Joe resigned, which was a severe blow because we needed him desperately.
sentences.cn: 乔辞职了，这是一个巨大的打击，因为我们非常需要他。

sentences.en: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale .
sentences.cn: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.en: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.cn: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.en: Sam stood his ground and got a blow that stunned him.
sentences.cn: 萨姆站在原地，被一下打昏了。

sentences.en: She tried to blow a gray strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.cn: 她竭力想把眼前的一缕白发吹开。

sentences.en: That concert blew me away.
sentences.cn: 音乐会震撼了我

sentences.en: The car struck him a glancing blow on the forehead.
sentences.cn: 那辆汽车蹭伤了他的前额。

sentences.en: The deportations would be a death blow to the peace process.
sentences.cn: 这些驱逐行动将给和平进程带来致命的一击。

sentences.en: The election result dealt a further blow to the party.
sentences.cn: 竞选结果进一步打击了这个政党。

sentences.en: The factory closures came as a blow to the local economy.
sentences.cn: 工厂关闭是对当地经济的一个打击。

sentences.en: The final blow for many firms was the government’s abolition of import duties.
sentences.cn: 对于许多公司来说，政府取消进口税是最后致命的一击。

sentences.en: The price of a cut and blow-dry varies widely.
sentences.cn: 剪发并吹干的价格高低不等。

sentences.en: The storm blew over quickly. The scandal will soon blow over.
sentences.cn: 风暴迅速减退。丑闻将很快销声匿迹

sentences.en: The whistle blew and the train slid forward.
sentences.cn: 汽笛吹响，火车向前滑动。

sentences.en: The whistle blew for half time.
sentences.cn: 哨声响起，上半场结束。

words.tran_cn: 吹制的，吹出的；开花的，盛开的；喘气的
有风的；风大的；随风飘动的
鼓风机，吹风机；吹制工；<俚>爱吹牛的人
吹；鼓风（blow的现在分词）；充气

phrases.phrase: be blown out of the water

phrases.tran_cn: （尤指通过呼吸新鲜空气）提神，清醒脑子
v. 偶然来访；被风吹进；井喷；[美俚]挥霍
爆发：以势不可挡之势爆发。用于指煤气或油井
(非正式)（用枪）击中某人头部将其杀死
(北美，非正式)远远胜过，比…更为成功

trans.tran_en: an action or event that causes difficulty or sadness for someone

trans.tran_cn: 吹，刮，擤（鼻子），送飞吻，熔断，炸毁，挥霍，泄露（秘密），失掉（机会），离开（某地）
trans.tran_en: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

trans.tran_cn: 吹，充气；吹响，吹奏；爆炸，炸毁
trans.tran_en: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves
